member.summary: Object that holds element parameters
member.typeparam: Defines the type of the derived class, which is used to access properties of the derived class at compile time.
member.remarks: This class implements the Curiously Recurring Template Pattern (CRTP) by using a generic type parameter that represents the derived class itself. This pattern enables static polymorphism, allowing the base class to use functionality from the derived class at compile time. In the GetItems method, this pattern allows the base class to access properties of the derived class through reflection while maintaining type safety.

member.name: T:DynamoForRevitUtils.Entities.Wrappers.ElementWrapper
member.summary: Represents an abstract base class for wrapping Revit elements.

remarks.para: Use this class in conjunction with the and to enhance the way you access element parameters.
The class represents the Revit Element and the represents the parameters of this element.

To use these classes together, proceed as follows:
Create a class derived from to represent specific characteristics of the elements you want to represent.
Create properties of type in classes derived from to represent element parameters.
Use the attribute to create a bound between properties of the with the properties of the
Use in getters/setters of properties of the to get/set the values of the parameters, directly from/to the element instances in Revit.
This way you will no longer need to worry about fetching parameters from elements every time you need to get/set their values. Use the properties of the normally and their values will be automatically get/set from/to the element instances in Revit.

example.name: ElementWrapper
ElementParameterMap

member.name: M:DynamoForRevitUtils.Services.RevitServices.WallServices.GetProtoSolid(Autodesk.Revit.DB.Wall)
member.summary: Get the protosolid of a Wall.
member.remarks:
This method uses a different approach from ToProtoType() method. It uses the Wall's physical location and dimensions to create a .
The returned solid does not contains openings, it is a simple extrusion of the Wall's location curve. Use this method to analyze the Wall's geometry without considering its openings.
member.param: The Wall to get the protosolid from.
member.returns: The protosolid of the Wall.
